Text: Kinda new to this... What do you mean by "mount with MagicISO or Daemon Tools"? I'd prefer not to burn it to a disc. Could you elaborate, please?

Yes, you'd normally have to burn to a disk, but that is the power of those programs that are mentioned to d/l. They create a virtual drive to make your pc think there's the actual disk in the drive, all without having to burn a thing to any disk.
